headline.main: Britons Fight The Battle Of the Bulge; A Lot of Eating for One Day Sponsoring the Pounds Away A New Gym for Parliament Focus on TV and Ad Industry

docs.abstract: Article on Brit Health Educ Council campaign against excessive smoking in GB; illus (M)

byline.original: By SUSAN HELLER ANDERSON Special to The New York Times

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON--In a rare show of unanimity, the Health Education Council, the Trade Unions Council, the British Heart Foundation, the army, Members of Parliament, the Royal Association for Disability and Rehabilitation and the television industry have fired a coordinated broadside calculated to change the bad habits of the British.
